skill.name: solidity-security
skill.description: Master smart contract security best practices to prevent common vulnerabilities and implement secure Solidity patterns. Use when writing smart contracts, auditing existing contracts, or implementing security measures for blockchain applications.
skill.summary: Master smart contract security best practices to prevent common vulnerabilities and implement secure...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based educational skill containing only Solidity security guidance. No code execution, file access, network calls, or external command capabilities detected.

content.value_statement: Smart contracts fail from reentrancy, overflow, and access control mistakes. This skill guides secure patterns, checks, and testing steps to prevent common vulnerabilities.
actual_capabilities: Explain reentrancy risks and the checks-effects-interactions pattern
Recommend ReentrancyGuard usage for critical functions
Clarify overflow and underflow protections by Solidity version
Outline access control patterns with Ownable or roles
Describe front-running mitigation with commit-reveal scheme
Provide gas optimization tips such as packed storage and calldata
limitations: Does not execute or audit real contracts automatically
Does not run tools like Slither or Mythril
Cannot verify deployed contract state or on-chain data
Does not replace a professional security audit

use_cases.description: Apply safe patterns while building token or vault logic

use_cases.title: Prepare audit notes
use_cases.description: Generate a checklist of common Solidity risks to review

use_cases.title: Reduce launch risk
use_cases.description: Identify security gaps before a public deployment

prompt_templates.title: Basic safety review
prompt_templates.prompt: List the top security risks for a simple ERC20 token and the safe patterns I should follow.

prompt_templates.title: Reentrancy guidance
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my withdraw flow and explain how to apply checks-effects-interactions and ReentrancyGuard.

prompt_templates.title: Front-running plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest a commit-reveal approach to reduce front-running in a swap function.

prompt_templates.title: Audit checklist
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a concise security checklist for a DeFi lending contract with access control, math safety, and external calls.

output_examples.input: Give me a short security checklist for a Solidity vault contract.
output: Confirm reentrancy protection on withdraw and external calls
Verify access control on admin functions
Check overflow safety for arithmetic operations
Ensure input validation for recipients and amounts
Review event emission for state changes

best_practices: Use checks-effects-interactions pattern for all external calls
Prefer pull payments over push payments for distribution
Pin Solidity versions and document assumptions clearly
anti_patterns: Unchecked low-level calls without return value verification

faq.question: Is this compatible with my Solidity version?
faq.answer: Yes, it covers patterns for pre-0.8 and 0.8+ with clear version notes for each.

faq.question: Does it audit my code automatically?
faq.answer: No, it provides guidance, patterns, and checklists rather than automated analysis.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Slither or Mythril?
faq.answer: It can recommend these tools, but it does not run external analysis tools.

faq.question: Is my data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No, the skill content is static with no data collection or network requests.

faq.question: What if my contract uses proxy patterns?
faq.answer: Ask for upgrade safety checks and storage layout guidance for proxy implementations.

faq.question: How does it compare to a real audit?
faq.answer: It helps with preparation and best practices, but a professional audit is still required.
